info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 17 at 3:17PM PST until January 17 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Ice Storm Warning, significant icing. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...For the Ice Storm Warning, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain will slowly dissipate this evening with a few lingering showers falling as rain through early Thursday morning. Snow accumulations will be highest near Parkdale and above 1500 feet in elevation.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages.
